confoedero: <entryFree id="n10181" type="main" key="confoede^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-foedĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n10181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to unite</hi> or <hi rend="ital">join by a league</hi> (mostly in eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n10181.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinae impiis nuptiis confoederatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10181.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: membra, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 437: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam nascentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 4</bibl></cit>, n. 1 al.</sense></entryFree>
confoedo: <entryFree id="n10182" type="hapax" key="confoedo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-foedo</orth>, <itype>āvi, āre</itype>, <sense id="n10182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pollute, defile</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 200 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
confoedustus: <entryFree id="n10183" type="gloss" key="confoedustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confoedustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>con-foedus; cf. onustus, vetustus, from onus, vetus</etym>, <sense id="n10183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">joined in alliance</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=41:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 41, 2</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
conforaneus: <entryFree id="n10184" type="gloss" key="confo^ra_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confŏrānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">working</hi> or <hi rend="ital">selling at the same market-place</hi>, Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
confore: <entryFree id="n10185" type="main" key="confo^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confŏre</orth>, v. consum.</entryFree>
conforio: <entryFree id="n10186" type="hapax" key="confo^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confŏrĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, 4</itype> <etym>2. foria</etym>, <sense id="n10186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pollute, defile</hi>, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 114, 12</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 64 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
conformalis: <entryFree id="n10187" type="main" key="conforma_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conformālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conformo</etym>, <sense id="n10187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conformable, like, similar</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res Carn. 47</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conformatio: <entryFree id="n10188" type="main" key="conforma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conformātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a symmetrical forming</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fashioning, conformation, shape, form</hi> (freq. in the philos. and rhet. writings of Cic.; elsewhere rare). </sense><sense id="n10188.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">lineamentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:18:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 18, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis sit (animus) in ipso corpore, quae conformatio, quae magnitudo, qui locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam et figura totius oris et corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10188.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10188.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <trans><tr>expression of voice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <trans><tr>arrangement</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum et sententiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 52, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conformatio et moderatio continentiae et temperantiae,</quote> <trans><tr>conformation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:25:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi, i. q. notio,</quote> <trans><tr>an idea, notion, conception</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:38:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 38, 105</bibl></cit>.—Also without animi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 357</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:5:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 5, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10188.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in rhet., <hi rend="ital">a figure of speech</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:37:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 37, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:1" default="NO">9, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10188.5" n="2" level="3"> In later rhett. esp., <hi rend="ital">a prosopopœia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 53, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1340</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
conformator: <entryFree id="n10189" type="hapax" key="conforma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conformātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a framer, former</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 80, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conformis: <entryFree id="n10190" type="main" key="conformis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conformis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>forma</etym>, <sense id="n10190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">similar, like</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 12</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conformes fieri imaginis Filii sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 8, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conformo: <entryFree id="n10191" type="main" key="conformo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-formo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to form, fashion, shape symmetrically</hi> or <hi rend="ital">skilfully</hi> (several times in Cic.; elsewhere very rare). </sense><sense id="n10191.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">si mundum aedificatum esse, non a naturā conformatum putarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad majora quaedam nos natura genuit et conformavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: quercus conformata securi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 19, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ursa) fetum lambendo conformat et fingit,</quote> <trans><tr>licks into shape</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: ova in volucrum speciem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginem tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:9:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10191.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: puellam, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 174, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum et mentem cogitatione hominum excellentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse me conformo ad ejus voluntatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">liberos parente orbatos sibi et posteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:29:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 29, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem hujus hortatu praeceptisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem constructione verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 114</bibl>, the right read. is confirmem).</sense></entryFree>
confornicatio: <entryFree id="n10192" type="main" key="conforni^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confornĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confornico</etym>, <sense id="n10192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vaulting over</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 6, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confornico: <entryFree id="n10193" type="main" key="conforni^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fornĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to over-arch, vault over</hi> (Vitr.): <cit><quote lang="la">cellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conforto: <entryFree id="n10194" type="main" key="conforto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conforto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fortis</etym>, <sense id="n10194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strengthen much</hi> (late Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in the Vulg. of the Vet. Test.): stomachum, Macer. Carm. 71: manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum Juda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confortamini, filii Benjamin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 6, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
confossus: <entryFree id="n10195" type="main" key="confossus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confossus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from confodio.</entryFree>
confoveo: <entryFree id="n10196" type="main" key="confo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n10196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to warm, foster, cherish assiduously</hi> (ante- and post-class.): hominem, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 523, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra cibo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 204, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina gremio suo (terra),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Rufin. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confractio: <entryFree id="n10197" type="main" key="confracti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confractĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confringo</etym>, <sense id="n10197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breach, rupture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:24:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 24, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:105:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 105, 23</bibl> (al. confractura).</sense></entryFree>
confractura: <entryFree id="n10198" type="main" key="confractu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confractūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. confractio. <pb n="417" /> <cb n="CONF" /></entryFree>
confractus: <entryFree id="n10199" type="main" key="confractus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from confringo.</entryFree>
confrages: <entryFree id="n10200" type="gloss" key="confra_ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confrāges</orth>, v. ‡ conflages.</entryFree>
confragosus: <entryFree id="n10201" type="main" key="confra^go_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-frăgōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., broken, rough, uneven</hi> (in good prose; cf. confragus; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10201.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:20:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus lapidibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 17, 2</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">via (together with ardua et aspera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 84:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 84, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 41, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26, 5</bibl>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">confrăgōsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a rough place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">region</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortior miles ex confragoso venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 51:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 51, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra inter confragosa omnia locat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 32, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26, 5</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">e confragosis atque asperis evecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10201.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (several times in Plaut. and in Quint. like fragosus; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewhere rare): condiciones,</quote> <trans><tr>hard, difficult</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 70</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with velut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina quaedam versusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta (together with horrida),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, Mall. Theod. Metr. 7.—No <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">confrăgōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">roughly, unevenly</hi>, Mar. Vict. p. 2550.</sense></entryFree>
confragus: <entryFree id="n10202" type="main" key="confra^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confrăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>confringo</etym> (post-Aug.; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for confragosus), <sense id="n10202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rough, rugged, uneven</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dumeta densis arboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:581" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 581</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-frăga</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a rough place, thicket</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:494" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 494</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp., sup.</hi>, and <pos>adv.</pos> not in use.</sense></entryFree>
confremo: <entryFree id="n10203" type="main" key="confre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-frĕmo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to sound aloud, resound, to murmur loudly</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">confremuere omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:72" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">confremit et caelum et ... circus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:398" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confrequento: <entryFree id="n10204" type="main" key="confre^quento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-frĕquento</orth>, no <sense id="n10204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to visit frequently</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in great numbers, to frequent</hi> (post-Aug. and rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 13, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2417</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4414</bibl>: harenas, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 1, 7.</sense></entryFree>
confricamentum: <entryFree id="n10205" type="hapax" key="confri^ca_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confrĭcāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>confrico</etym>, <sense id="n10205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">something for rubbing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <trans><tr>a dentifrice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:4:78" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 4, 78</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confricatio: <entryFree id="n10206" type="hapax" key="confri^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confrĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vigorous rubbing. friction;</hi> trop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 4:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 4, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confrico: <entryFree id="n10207" type="main" key="confri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-frĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to rub vigorously, to rub in</hi> (belonging to econom. and medic. lang.). </sense><sense id="n10207.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput atque os suum unguento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os sale trito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confricatis dentibus atque gingivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 9, § 31</bibl></cit>: faciem sibi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 3, 20, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10207.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">genua,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to touch the knees in earnest entreaty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 80</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confringo: <entryFree id="n10208" type="main" key="confringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confringo</orth>, <itype>frēgi, fractum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>frango</etym>, <sense id="n10208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break in pieces</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10208.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">hirneam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pultando pedibus paene confregi hasce ambas (fores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores caedendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 46, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portarum claustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbrices et tegulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 30, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 10, 45, § 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores vi tempestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enses ensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres valli impetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confracta navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaeptra manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 272" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 272</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">tesseram (hospitalem),</quote> <trans><tr>to break friendship, violate faith</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10208.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to break, bring to naught, destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <trans><tr>to dissipate, run through property</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 71</bibl>: superbiam, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 316, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia senatoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:5:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 5, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>, ext. 17: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 69</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">confractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., broken, uneven</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in confracto (opp. in aequo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confrio: <entryFree id="n10209" type="main" key="confri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-frĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n10209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, āre, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to rub in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid sale,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:60" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confrixo: <entryFree id="n10210" type="hapax" key="confrixo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confrixo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>frigo</etym>, <sense id="n10210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to roast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fry with something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid cum oleo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confuga: <entryFree id="n10211" type="main" key="confu^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confŭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>confugio</etym>, <sense id="n10211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who takes refuge somewhere, a refugee</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 12, 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
confugela: <entryFree id="n10212" type="gloss" key="confu^ge_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confŭgēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, an old word for confugium, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=39:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 39, 9</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
confugio: <entryFree id="n10213" type="main" key="confu^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fŭgĭo</orth>, <itype>fūgi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to flee to for</hi> <cb n="CONF" /> <hi rend="ital">refuge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">succor, take refuge in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10213.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad me nocte primā domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 12, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 666</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphicr. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Iphicr. 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arcem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:8:12" default="NO">9, 8, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Peliae ad limina supplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ipsos deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:688" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 688</bibl></cit>: ad fana deorum, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vestras manus. ad vestra arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phylen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Perusiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10213.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take refuge in, have recourse to</hi> (esp. freq. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad opem judicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 11, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad florentes Etruscorum opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad meam fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad clementiam tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:63" default="NO">11, 3, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 19, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad artes patrias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:572 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 572 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (philosophiae) in sinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tuam fidem, veritatem, misericordiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi ad aram in exsilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:34:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 34, 100</bibl></cit>: neque tu scilicet Eo nunc confugies: Quid mea, etc.? <hi rend="ital">to take refuge</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">excuse yourself with</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 45</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">an illuc confugies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:83:section=191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 83, § 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicurus confugit illuc, ut neget, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habebam quo confugerem, ubi conquiescerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confugiet ad imprudentiam, stultitiam, adulescentiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confugitur aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Inst. Div. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mort. Persec. 33, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confugium: <entryFree id="n10214" type="main" key="confu^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confŭgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>confugio</etym>, <sense id="n10214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place of refuge, a refuge, shelter</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:5:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:504" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 504</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confui: <entryFree id="n10215" type="main" key="confu^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confŭi</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">confŭtūrum</orth>, etc., v. consum.</entryFree>
confulgeo: <entryFree id="n10216" type="main" key="confulge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fulgĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n10216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to shine brightly, to glitter, glisten</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in the foll. exs.): aedes confulgebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 44</bibl>: lucida confulgent alti carchesia mali, Cinna ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confultus: <entryFree id="n10217" type="hapax" key="confultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fulcio</etym>, <sense id="n10217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pressed together</hi> ( = confertus, conglomeratus): <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 98</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
confundo: <entryFree id="n10218" type="main" key="confundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fundo</orth>, <itype>fūdi, fūsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n10218.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To pour, mingle</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">mix together</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10218.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">unā multa jura (cocos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 120</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jus confusum sectis herbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(venenum) in poculo, cum ita confusum esset ut secerni nullo modo posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 62, 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:3:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 1, 3, § 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ignis oculorum cum eo igne, qui est ob os offusus, se confudit et contulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumque tuis lacrimis lacrimas confundere nostras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confundere crebroque permiscere mel, acetum, oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia arenti ramo (Medea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Alpheus) Siculis confunditur undis,</quote> <trans><tr>mingles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 696</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mixtum flumini subibat mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cornua cervi contrita) pulvereae confusa farinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10218.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10218.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to mingle, unite, join, combine</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">(decorum) totum illud quidem est cum virtute confusum, sed mente cogitatione distinguitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 27, 95</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vera cum falsis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est id quidem in totam orationem confundendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:79:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 79, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis quaedam sentiens quae est toto confusa mundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 52, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones in unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 12, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 46, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo populi in unum confusi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: diversum confusa genus panthera camelo ( = camelopardalis, <hi rend="ital">the giraffe</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 195</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rusticus urbano confusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 213</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque continuos dactylos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subjecta sibi vocalis in unum sonum coalescere et confundi nequiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 26</bibl></cit>.—Of bringing together in speech: <cit><quote lang="la">cuperem equidem utrumque (una dijudicare), sed est difficile confundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 26, 100</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 23 al.</bibl></cit>—More freq., </sense><sense id="n10218.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp., with the idea of confounding, disarranging, <hi rend="ital">to confound, confuse, jumble together, bring into disorder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an tu haec ita confundis et perturbas, ut quicumque velit, quod velit, quo modo velit possit dedicare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:49:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 49, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis corporis atque animi sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:946" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 946</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 439</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra per multum confundi verba necesse'st Et conturbari vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 558</bibl></cit>: <cb n="CONF" /> confusa venit vox inque pedita, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:562 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 562 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">censeo omnis in oratione esse quasi permixtos et confusos pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:195" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 57, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">particulae primum confusae postea in ordinem adductae a mente divinā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa et ordines peditum atque equitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 27, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinem disciplinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinem militiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum (together with conturbare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit> et saep.: foedus, <hi rend="ital">to violate</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">sugxe/ein</foreign>, Hom. Il. 4, 269), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 496</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 290</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa imis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium, promissa, preces confundit in unum,</quote> <trans><tr>mingles together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 472</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura et nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:346" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 346</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasque nefasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:585" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in chaos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:299" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:283" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 283</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum terris miscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">ora fractis in ossibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to disfigure the features, make them undistinguishable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 1117" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 1117</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia corporis lineamenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 105, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 5, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:758" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 758</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:232" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 232</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris notas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:3:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si irruptione fluminis fines agri confudit inundatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa Non agnoscendo confusa reliquit in ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum Lunae,</quote> <trans><tr>to cloud, obscure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:367" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 367</bibl></cit>.—Of disordered health: <cit><quote lang="la">neque apparet, quod corpus confuderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10218.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of intellectual confusion, <hi rend="ital">to disturb, disconcert, confound, perplex</hi> (freq. after the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not in Cic.): audientium animos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 42, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:50:1" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 50, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum confusa memoria esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:50:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 50, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos (fulmina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me gravi dolore (nuntius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 70, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inmitem animum imagine tristi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander pudore confusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum ingens confundit honos inopinaque turbat gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:283" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 283</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:68" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentiam monitoris confundit multitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10218.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To diffuse, suffuse, spread over</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n10218.7" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus in eam venam, quae cava appellatur, confunditur,</quote> <trans><tr>diffuses itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum in ea (vasa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruorem in fossam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10218.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to throw in great numbers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela per foramina muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:333" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 333</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10218.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in totam orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:79:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 79, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim quandam sentientem atque divinam, quae toto confusa mundo sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:15:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 15, 35</bibl></cit>: rosa ingenuo confusa rubore, <hi rend="ital">suffused with</hi>, etc., Col. poët. 10, 260.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">confūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B. 2.), <hi rend="ital">brought into disorder, confused, perplexed, disorderly</hi> (class. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">ruina mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 607</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 562</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:613" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 613</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio confusa, perturbata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:13:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 13, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 666</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 606</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 18, 9</bibl></cit> Drak. ad loc. (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">confusio suffragiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 23, 47</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">confusissimus mos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse confusus animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 6, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:35:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 35, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maerore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irā, pudore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 134, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbā querelarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:2:3 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 2, 3 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex recenti morsu animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Masinissa ex praetorio in tabernaculum suum confusus concessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc onusti cibo et vino perturbata et confusa cernimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 74, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">91, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">confusus atque incertus animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rediit confuso voltu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ore confuso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">confusior facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavor confusior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, prooem. 1, § 5.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">confūsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., confusedly, without order, disorderly</hi> (several times in Cic.; elsewh. rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Quint.): confuse et permiste dispergere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">confuse varieque sententias dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utraque res conjuncte et confuse comparata est, Auct. her. 4, 47, 60: universis mancipiis constitutum pretium,</quote> <trans><tr>in the lump</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confusius acta res est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> not in use.</sense></entryFree>
confunero: <entryFree id="n10219" type="hapax" key="confu_ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fūnĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to bury, inter;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to ruin, destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 4, 96</bibl></cit> (acc. to Barth. Adv. 13, 19).</sense></entryFree>
confusaneus: <entryFree id="n10220" type="hapax" key="confu_sa_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confūsānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>confusus</etym>,<pb n="418" /> <cb n="CONG" />  <sense id="n10220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mingled, miscellaneous</hi>: doctrina, Gell. prooem. § 5.</sense></entryFree>
confuse: <entryFree id="n10221" type="main" key="confu_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confūsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. confundo, <sense id="n10221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
confusim: <entryFree id="n10222" type="hapax" key="confu_sim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confūsim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>confusus</etym>, <sense id="n10222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a confused, perplexed manner</hi>, = confuse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 4</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
confusio: <entryFree id="n10223" type="main" key="confu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confundo</etym>. <sense id="n10223.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mingling</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10223.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">si duorum materiae ex voluntate dominorum confusae sint, totum id corpus quod ex confusione fit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:1:27" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:23:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 1, 23, § 5</bibl>: colorum, App. de Mundo, p. 66, 24, 2.—</sense><sense id="n10223.2" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a mixture, union</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcum esse multarum imaginum solis confusiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10223.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10223.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A mingling, mixing, uniting, combining</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">haec conjunctio confusioque virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 67</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., and in good prose, </sense><sense id="n10223.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A confounding, confusion, disorder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:10:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:19:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 19, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragiorum (i. e. not according to centuries, but viritim),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 23, 47</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">confusum suffragium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 18, 9</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">perturbatio et confusio vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 22, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi circuli et indecora confusio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 20, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:86:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 86, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 101, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10223.6" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to confundo, II. B.) Oris, <hi rend="ital">a reddening, blushing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confusus: <entryFree id="n10224" type="main" key="confu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>confundo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
confutatio: <entryFree id="n10225" type="hapax" key="confu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confuto</etym>, <sense id="n10225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a confutation</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lu/sis</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confutator: <entryFree id="n10226" type="hapax" key="confu_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confūtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a refuter, opponent</hi>: Valentini, Hier. Script. Eccl.</sense></entryFree>
confuto: <entryFree id="n10227" type="main" key="confu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fūto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>futo, v. <hi rend="ital">intens.</hi> from foveo</etym>, <sense id="n10227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to check</hi> or <hi rend="ital">repress a boiling liquid, to suppress, restrain, check</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10227.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: cocus magnum ahenum quando fervit, paulā confutat truā, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 87, 13</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 128 Rib.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. p. 87:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. p. 87, 11</bibl>.—Hence (far more freq.), </sense><sense id="n10227.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10227.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to repress, diminish, impede, destroy, put to silence</hi>: nostras secundas res, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximos dolores inventorum suorum memoriā et recordatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 31</bibl></cit> 88: <cit><quote lang="la">audaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:38:134" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 38, 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10227.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10227.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put down by words, to put to silence, confute</hi> (so class.): sensus judjcum imperiosis comminationibus, Tiro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego istos, qui nunc me culpant, confutaverim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratum senem verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10227.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To refute, confute, disprove, answer conclusively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc tactum confutabunt nares?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta Stoicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionis levitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:17:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 17, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut verba magnifica rebus confutaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo sibi argumento confutatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10227.7" n="3" level="3"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">to convict</hi>, Cod. Th. 11, 8, 1.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocuisse quibusdam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot suscepisse labores et pericula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confutuo: <entryFree id="n10228" type="hapax" key="confu^tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fŭtŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lie with conjugally</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 37, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confuturum: <entryFree id="n10229" type="main" key="confu^tu_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confŭtūrum</orth>, v. consum.</entryFree>
congarrio: <entryFree id="n10230" type="main" key="congarri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-garrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n10230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to gabble much, to prattle</hi>, Antonin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. 1:15" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. 1, 15</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
congaudeo: <entryFree id="n10231" type="main" key="congaudeo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gaudeo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n10231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to rejoice with one</hi> (eccl. Lat.): alicui, Tert. adv. Gnost. c. 13; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 50 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
congedus: <entryFree id="n10232" type="main" key="Conge^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Congĕdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Spain, tributary to the Iberus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:49:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 49, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congelasco: <entryFree id="n10233" type="main" key="conge^lasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕlasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype> (no <sense id="n10233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to freeze, congeal</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">oleum, vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 12, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 10, § 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congelatio: <entryFree id="n10234" type="main" key="conge^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congĕlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>congelo</etym>, <sense id="n10234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a freezing, congealing</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not ante-Aug.): liquoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 21, § 33</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">brumae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
congelo: <entryFree id="n10235" type="main" key="conge^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n10235.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to cause to freeze up, to congeal</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10235.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:12" default="NO">12, 50, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare congelatum,</quote> <trans><tr>the sea being frozen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congelati gutta nasi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:98:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 98, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10235.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to thicken, make hard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <trans><tr>to curdle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lapidem rictus serpentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi se adeps congelaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 271" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 271</bibl></cit>.—Humorously: <cit><quote lang="la">quid prodest, si te congelat uxor anus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:147:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 147, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10235.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to freeze, freeze up</hi>. * </sense><sense id="n10235.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Ister <cb n="CONG" /> congelat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10235.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow hard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 307</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 415</bibl>. —* </sense><sense id="n10235.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: gaudebam sane et congelasse nostrum amicum laetabar otio, <hi rend="ital">had frozen together</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">had become wholly inactive</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 3</bibl>; cf. conglacio, I. B.</sense></entryFree>
congeminatio: <entryFree id="n10236" type="hapax" key="conge^mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">congĕmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>congemino</etym>, <sense id="n10236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a doubling;</hi> connected with conduplicatio, in com. lang., for <hi rend="ital">embracing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congemino: <entryFree id="n10237" type="main" key="conge^mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to double, redouble, repeat, reduplicate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc si pateram patera peperit, omnes congeminavimus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have produced our like, doubled ourselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L (litteram),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:S. 9:9" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> S. 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebros ictus ensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 714</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the same sense, securim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 698</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspiria rauco fremitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:267" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paeana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:512" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 512</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:201" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 201</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. p. 6, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congemisco: <entryFree id="n10238" type="main" key="conge^misco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕmisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to sigh deeply</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 30</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 411 al.</sense></entryFree>
congemo: <entryFree id="n10239" type="main" key="conge^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕmo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n10239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10239.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to sigh</hi> or <hi rend="ital">groan deeply</hi> or <hi rend="ital">loudly, to heave a sigh</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10239.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop. (rare but class.): congemuit senatus frequens, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:25:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 25, 51</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10239.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, of trees cut down: supremum congemuit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 631</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10239.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to deplore, lament, bewail</hi>: quid mortem congemis ac fles? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:934" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 934</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">positum feretro congemuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
congener: <entryFree id="n10240" type="hapax" key="conge^ner1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕner</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>genus</etym>, <sense id="n10240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the same race</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kind;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 24, 28, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10241" type="main" key="conge^ner2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕner</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joint son-inlaw</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 8:40" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 8, 40</bibl> dub. (al. generi).</sense></entryFree>
congenero: <entryFree id="n10242" type="main" key="conge^ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕnĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n10242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10242.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To beget</hi> or <hi rend="ital">produce at the same time</hi> (very rare; perh. only in the foll. exs., and only in the <hi rend="ital">perf. part.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">porci congenerati,</quote> <trans><tr>of the same litter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; so in <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senium parentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">congeneratum verbum,</quote> <trans><tr>of the same root</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=39" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10242.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To unite by affinity, to connect</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 84, 28</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 580 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
congenitus: <entryFree id="n10243" type="main" key="conge^ni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕnĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [gigno], <sense id="n10243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born</hi> or <hi rend="ital">produced together with</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not ante-Aug.): pili,</quote> <trans><tr>congenital</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 94, § 230</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastitas roborum mundo,</quote> <trans><tr>coëval with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>; Tert. Test. Anim. c. 5.</sense></entryFree>
congentiles: <entryFree id="n10244" type="gloss" key="congenti_les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gentīles</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">kindred, of the same stock</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2491</bibl>; cf. congentilis, <foreign lang="greek">o(mo/eqnos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
congenuclo: <entryFree id="n10245" type="hapax" key="conge^nu_^clo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕnū^clo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>geniculo</etym>, <sense id="n10245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall upon the knees</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 89, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
congenulatus: <entryFree id="n10246" type="hapax" key="conge^nu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-gĕnŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [genu], <sense id="n10246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fallen upon the knees</hi>: multi congenulati, etc., Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 57, 32</bibl> (perh. congenuclati should be the reading; cf. congenuclo).</sense></entryFree>
