Conjecturā si reperire possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc ego de me conjecturam domi facic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:74:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 74, 299</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjecturam facere (ex re or re),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 21, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:74:section=183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 74, § 183</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">attendite num aberret a conjecturā suspitio periculi mei,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>reasonable inference</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:20" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere ex re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc videre licet ex aliquot rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjecturā uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicare aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coarguere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36, 126</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeritur per conjecturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjecturā aberrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in conjecturam quantitas cadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid conjecturā animi scrutari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 11, 8, § 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animi mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: si qua conjectura mentis divinae sit (<hi rend="ital">gen. object.</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:39:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 39, 15</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:45" default="NO">7, 2, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 7</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10336.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10336.3" n="A" level="2"> T. t. of the lang. of augury, <hi rend="ital">a conclusion drawn from signs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">omens, a divining, an interpreting of dreams, soothsaying, prophesying</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 31, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 36, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 63, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10336.4" n="B" level="2"> An <hi rend="ital">element of rhetorical representation founded on conjecture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:5:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:9:33 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 9, 33 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div.. 2, 26, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:50" default="NO">3, 6, 50</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in his omnibus conjecturam inducere,</quote> <trans><tr>the form of conjecture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:32:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 32, 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conjecturalis: <entryFree id="n10337" type="main" key="conjectu_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjectūrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conjectura</etym>, <sense id="n10337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to conjecture</hi> or <hi rend="ital">guessing, conjectural</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars medicina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 6</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Esp. freq. in rhet. lang.: causa, Cic. <cb n="CONJ" /> Top. 24, 92: <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib. 11:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 29</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-jectūrālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">conjectures</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:8" default="NO">4, 4, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">conjec-tūrālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">conjeclurally, by conjecture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil conjecturaliter gestum, nil per ambages,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
conjectus: <entryFree id="n10338" type="main" key="conjectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from conicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10339" type="main" key="conjectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>conicio</etym> (rare but class.; most freq. in Lucr.). <sense id="n10339.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A throwing together</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10339.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A crowding, connecting</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">uniting together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altior animaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:960" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 960</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10339.2" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a conflux, concourse, confluence; a heap, crowd, pile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elementorum confluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae conjectu siccari amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 4, 9, § 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10339.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A throwing, throwing down, casting, projecting, hurling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidum conjectu fracta domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire ad teli conjectum,</quote> <trans><tr>to come within weapons' throw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 31, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 14, 19</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the opp.: extra teli conjectum consistere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 90, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(jaculorum) ex altioribus locis in cavam vallem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 16, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi quid pugno bracchique superne Conjectu trudatur,</quote> <trans><tr>the thrust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 435</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10339.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10339.5" n="1" level="3"> Of the eyes, <hi rend="ital">a turning, directing, throwing</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum in me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:54:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 54, 115</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 222</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:101" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo telorum sed oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:17:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 17, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10339.6" n="2" level="3"> Of the mind, etc., <hi rend="ital">a turning, directing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjectus animorum in me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:54:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 54, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:17:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjectura dicta est a conjectu, id est directione quādam rationis ad veritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10339.7" n="3" level="3"> = conjectura; progredi conjectu longius, Auct. Vict. <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> 26, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conjicio: <entryFree id="n10340" type="main" key="conji^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjĭcĭo</orth>, v. conicio.</entryFree>
conjubeo: <entryFree id="n10341" type="hapax" key="conju^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-jŭbĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n10341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to command together with</hi>, Edict. Diocl. prooem.</sense></entryFree>
conjucundor: <entryFree id="n10342" type="main" key="conju_cundor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-jūcundor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n10342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to rejoice with one</hi> (late Lat.); with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amico,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 37, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conjuga: <entryFree id="n10343" type="main" key="conju^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjŭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. conjunx <sense id="n10343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
conjugalis: <entryFree id="n10344" type="main" key="conju^ga_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjŭgālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conjunx</etym>, <sense id="n10344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to marriage, conjugal</hi> (prob. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n10344.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di,</quote> <trans><tr>who preside over marriage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 1103" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 1103</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 9, 3.—</sense><sense id="n10344.2" n="b" level="4"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">faithful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">CONIVX,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 602, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1296, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10344.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">gregem protegere debent galli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-jŭgālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">as married persons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 89:39" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 89, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conjugaliter: <entryFree id="n10345" type="main" key="conju^ga_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjŭgālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. conjugalis <sense id="n10345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
conjugatio: <entryFree id="n10346" type="main" key="conju^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjŭgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conjugo</etym> (except twice in Cic. Top. only post-class.), <sense id="n10346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a combining, connecting;</hi> hence, prop., <hi rend="ital">a mingling, mixture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis et fellis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4</bibl></cit>, n. 18, p. 359, 29: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <trans><tr>carnal intercourse, coition</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursi velut humanis conjugationibus copulantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 26, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10346.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., t. t. </sense><sense id="n10346.2" n="A" level="2"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">the etymological relationship of words</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">suzugi/a</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10346.3" n="B" level="2"> In later gram., <hi rend="ital">conjugation;</hi> earlier called declinatio, q. v.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 311</bibl>; Commian. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 153</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 337</bibl> ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 836</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10346.4" n="C" level="2"> In logic, <hi rend="ital">a syllogism</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositionum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. p. 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conjugator: <entryFree id="n10347" type="hapax" key="conju^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjŭgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who joins</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unites, the uniter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni amoris (Hymenaeus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conjugialis: <entryFree id="n10348" type="main" key="conju^gi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjŭgĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conjugium</etym>, <sense id="n10348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to marriage, conjugal, connubial</hi> (perh. only in Ov.): <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:536" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 536</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conjugium: <entryFree id="n10349" type="main" key="conju^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjŭgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>conjugo</etym>, <sense id="n10349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a connection, union</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10349.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis atque animae (opp. discidium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:845" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 845</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter has (feminas) et Theodorum quasi conjugium animosi spiritūs esse potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>, ext. 3.—</sense><sense id="n10349.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a connection by marriage, marriage, wedlock</hi> (considered in a physical point of view, while conubium is regarded as a civil or political institution; cf. conubium; <cit><quote lang="la">class. in prose and poetry),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 475</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:804" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 804</bibl>.—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:336" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 336</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:104 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 34, 52, § 104 al.</bibl>; cf.: sine ullis Conjugiis<pb n="423" /> <cb n="CONJ" />  vento gravidae (equae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 275</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n10349.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10349.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Concubinage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 298</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 295</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10349.5" n="2" level="3"> (Abstr. pro concr.) <hi rend="ital">A husband</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 13, 20; <hi rend="ital">a wife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 296</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 423</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 433</bibl>; 11, 270; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 65</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre Inmitem dominam conjugiumque ferum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:74" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 74</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur., a pair</hi>, of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 23, 35, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 8, 7, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 12, 15, § 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conjugo: <entryFree id="n10350" type="main" key="conju^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-jŭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to join together, unite</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n10350.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to form, unite in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam sibi nuptiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 170, 35</bibl></cit>; and without a <case>dat.</case>, Treb. Gall. 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 6:13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 6, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10350.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugata verba,</quote> <trans><tr>etymologically related</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 3, 12</bibl></cit>, and 9, 38.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">conjŭgātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = conjugatio, II. A., q. v.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conjugulus: <entryFree id="n10351" type="main" key="conju^gu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjŭgŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conjugo</etym>, <sense id="n10351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to uniting, connecting</hi>: myrtus, only <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">133, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 37, § 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conjuncte: <entryFree id="n10352" type="main" key="conjuncte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjunctē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. conjungo, <sense id="n10352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
conjunctim: <entryFree id="n10353" type="main" key="conjunctim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjunctim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>conjungo</etym>, <sense id="n10353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unitedly, in common, jointly, together</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ratio habetur hujus omnis pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: referri de eā re, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere auxilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 9 al.</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:7:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 7, 9</bibl>, the right read. is conjuncte).</sense></entryFree>
conjunctio: <entryFree id="n10354" type="main" key="conjuncti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjunctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining together, connecting, uniting; union, conjunction</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10354.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">machina est continens ex materiā conjunctio maximas ad onerum motus habens virtutes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctionis rimas obducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Decl. 41, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10354.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (in good prose). </sense><sense id="n10354.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nos ad conjunctionem congregationemque hominum et ad naturalem communitatem esse natos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 23, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis cum externis mentibus,</quote> <trans><tr>agreement, affinity, sympathy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:58:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 58, 119</bibl></cit>; cf.: naturae, quam vocant <foreign lang="greek">sumpa/qeian</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 60, 124</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 69, 142: vicinitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indubitata litterarum inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10354.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10354.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A conjugal connection, marriage, wedlock</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 36, § 120</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10354.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A connection by relationship, affinity, relation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:54 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 54 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 11 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10354.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A connection by friendship, friendship, intimacy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil praetermisi quin Pompeium a Caesaris conjunctione avocarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paterna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 15, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 20, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:10:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 10, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10354.8" n="4" level="3"> In philos. and rhet. lang., <hi rend="ital">a connection of ideas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:14:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 14, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:6:12 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 6, 12 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:8:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:46" default="NO">8, 3, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10354.9" n="5" level="3"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">a connecting particle, a conjunction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 39, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:62" default="NO">9, 3, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:25" default="NO">11, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 86</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
conjunctivus: <entryFree id="n10355" type="main" key="conjuncti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjunctīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of connection</hi> or <hi rend="ital">serving to connect, connective</hi> (in post-class. gram. lang.): <cit><quote lang="la">particula (sc. autem),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Hermog. 26</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq.: conjunctivus modus, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">conjunc-tīvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the conjunctive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subjunctive mood</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 310 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
conjuncto: <entryFree id="n10356" type="main" key="conjuncto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjuncto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, false read. for conjungat, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 764</bibl>.)</entryFree>
conjunctrix: <entryFree id="n10357" type="main" key="conjunctrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjunctrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conjunctor, conjungo</etym>, <sense id="n10357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which joins</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unites together</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 11:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 11, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conjunctus: <entryFree id="n10358" type="main" key="conjunctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from conjungo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10359" type="main" key="conjunctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjunctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>conjungo</etym>, <sense id="n10359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a connection, conjunction</hi>, only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 24</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:91:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 91, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conjungo: <entryFree id="n10360" type="main" key="conjungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-jungo</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to bind together, connect, join, unite</hi> (very freq. in all perr. and species of composition); constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum, inter se</hi>, the <case>dat.</case>, or the <case>acc.</case> only; trop. also with <hi rend="ital">ad.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10360.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10360.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam epistulam cum hac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam cum animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturam tenuem gravi cum corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 563</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10360.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 559</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 137</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10360.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra muro oppidoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita cursum regebat, ut primi conjungi ultimis possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunguntur his (porticibus) domus ampliores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextrae dextram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 564</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10360.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With the <case>acc.</case> only: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to yoke together</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 138</bibl></cit>; <cb n="CONJ" /> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bis binos (equos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamost plures ceră,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostras manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:60" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oras (vulneris) suturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium intervallum ponte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilia conjuncta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10360.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10360.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10360.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eas cohortes cum exercitu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ego cum deorum laude conjungo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>put on an equality with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 10, 21</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii dedecus cum probro privato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 12, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Red. Sen. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,018:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. Quir. 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 31, 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium suum cum illius auctoritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem cum laude ac dignitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, pr. 33; 12, 2, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 331</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10360.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10360.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma finitimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 47, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudem oratori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:51" default="NO">5, 10, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequentia prioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—So of writings, <hi rend="ital">to add</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauca scribenda conjungendaque huic commentario statui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:48" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10360.11" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in tui familiarissimi judicio ac periculo tuum crimen conjungeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefarium est ... socium fallere qui se in negotio conjunxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia vota in unum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 86</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <case>acc.</case> only: <cit><quote lang="la">vocales,</quote> <trans><tr>to contract</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 44, 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 30</bibl>: bellum, <hi rend="ital">to carry on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wage in concert</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:52" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:632" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 632</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliae duae, quas hoc tempore uno imperio videmus esse conjunctas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequum est enim militum, talium praesertim, honorem conjungi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ... tantae nationes conjungantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc cape consiliis socium et conjunge volentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 712</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ... sicut inter se cohaerent tempore, ita opere ipso conjungi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstinentiam cibi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to continue without interruption</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the same sense, consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 17</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum actum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox eadem necem Britannici et rogum conjunxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 17</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10360.12" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10360.13" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To compose, form by uniting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (Epicurus) e duplici genere voluptatis conjunctus est (i. e. Epicuri summum bonum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit> Madv. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n10360.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To unite, join in marriage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">love</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me tecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam secum matrimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam sibi justo matrimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjungi Poppaeae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 335</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conubia Sabinorum (Romulus),</quote> <trans><tr>to bring about, accomplish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10360.15" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To connect, unite by the ties of relationship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">friendship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se tecum affinitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota domus conjugio et stirpe conjungitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos inter nos (res publica),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me tibi (studia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos sibi familiari amicitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ausonios Teucris foedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimum quemque hospitio et amicitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:5:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 5, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 16, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem amicitiamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 83:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 83, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">conjunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10360.16" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">United, connected;</hi> hence, of places, <hi rend="ital">bordering upon, near</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca, quae Caesaris castris erant conjuncta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 64 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paphlagonia Cappadociae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio Oceano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:46" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:8:31" default="NO">8, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratis crepidine saxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 653</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10360.17" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of time, <hi rend="ital">connected with, following</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae proelio apud Arbela conjuncta sunt ordiar dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10360.18" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10360.19" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">connected with, pertaining to; accordant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">agreeing with, conformable to</hi>, etc.; constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, the <case>dat.</case>, or rar. the <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentia cum justitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:9:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 9, 33</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nihil cum virtute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae sunt quasi conjuncta aut quae quasi pugnantia inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba inter se (opp. simplicia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:37:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 37, 149</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">(opp. singula),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:106" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:2" default="NO">7, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:1:1" default="NO">8, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae (opp. simplices),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:1" default="NO">3, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia intellegentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:9:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta officii naturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talis simulatio vanitati est conjunctior quam liberalitati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:81:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 81, 331</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido scelere conjuncta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 20</bibl>: haec necesse est aut ex praeterito tempore aut ex conjuncto <cb n="CONJ" /> aut ex sequenti petere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the present</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:8:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 8, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:94" default="NO">5, 10, 94</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuncta (et conveniens) constantia inter augures,</quote> <trans><tr>harmonious, accordant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:39:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 39, 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10360.20" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">conjunctum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10360.21" n="(a)" level="5"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">connection</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:40:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 40, 167</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39, 166</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10360.22" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A joint-sentence</hi>, = copulatum, <foreign lang="greek">sumpeplegme/non</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10360.23" n="(g)" level="5"> In the physical lang. of Lucr., <hi rend="ital">the necessary, inherent qualities of bodies</hi> (as weight, etc.), in contrast with eventum, merely external condition, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:449 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 449 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10360.24" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10360.25" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Connected by marriage, married</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">digno viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conservae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17, 5</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10360.26" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the vine (cf. conjunx, I. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitis ulmo marito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 54</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n10360.27" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Connected</hi> or <hi rend="ital">united by relationship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">friendship, allied, kindred, intimate, friendly</hi> (freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10360.28" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo vinculis et propinquitatis et adfinitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum populo Romano non solum perpetuā societate atque amicitiā, verum etiam cognatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:33:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 33, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites concordiā conjunctissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:55:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 55, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Mario sanguine conjunctissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:41:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propinquitatibus adfinitatibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">propinquā cognatione, Nep. praef. § 7: homo conjunctissimus officiis, usu, consuetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 20, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 1 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n10360.29" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tecum conjunctus siem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">genus cum diis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctus an alienus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 10</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctissimus huic ordini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 16, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas populo Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctior illo Nemo mihi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 599</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 3, 25</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se conjunctissimos fuisse Curium, Coruncanium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 11, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 11, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nosmet ipsi inter nos conjunctiores simus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl></cit>, B. 5.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">conjunctē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (rare; most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10360.30" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In connection, conjointly, at the same time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuncte cum reliquis rebus nostra contexere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuncte re verboque risus moveatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:61:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 61, 248</bibl></cit>: elatum aliquid, i. e. <hi rend="ital">hypothetically</hi> (opp. simpliciter, categorically), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 38, 158</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 37, 149: agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:7:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10360.31" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In a friendly, confidential manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuncte vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; so with vivere in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 8, 4</bibl>; and in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conjunx: <entryFree id="n10361" type="main" key="conjunx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjunx</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">conjux</orth> (in inscrr. also COIVX, e. g. Orell. 4655; 4644; 4646; <sense id="n10361.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">5013: COIVNX, C. I. L. 1, 1011: CONIVNCX,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 370</bibl></cit>; v. Neue, Formenl. I. p. 139 sq.), <itype>jŭgis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> (<hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">conjŭga</orth> <itype>Jovis Juno</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 174, 33</bibl>, and in inscrr.) [conjungo]. </sense><sense id="n10361.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who is united in marriage, a consort, spouse, wife;</hi> more rarely, <hi rend="ital">a husband</hi> (very freq., esp. in <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> and in the poets; in Ov. M. alone about fifty times); <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 32, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:81" default="NO" valid="yes">68, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 473</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 605</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 538</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 19:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Helv. 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 23" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4629</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1274</bibl>; Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 27, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 11, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 298</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:19:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 19, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 7</bibl>.— In <number>plur.</number> for <hi rend="ital">the married pair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unanimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 66, 80</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10361.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals, <hi rend="ital">the female</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:451" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 451</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 59, 79, § 161</bibl>.—And also of the elmtree, round which a vine entwines itself (cf. <itype>conjungo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, B. 2. b.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 18</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10361.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10361.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A betrothed, a bride</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 331</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 18</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10361.5" n="2" level="3"> A more honorable designation for <hi rend="ital">concubine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:208" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 208</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10361.6" n="II" level="1"> In late Lat., = contubernalis, <hi rend="ital">a comrade, a</hi> (male or female) <hi rend="ital">companion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attendant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2841 sq.</bibl>—So, <hi rend="ital">a fellow-slave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me cum meo famulo meoque vectore ... factum conservum atque conjugem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 189, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conjuratio: <entryFree id="n10362" type="main" key="conju_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conjuro</etym>, <sense id="n10362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swearing together</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10362.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n10362.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuratio fit in tumultu, i. e. Italico bello et Gallico quando vicinum urbis periculum singulos jurare non patitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 615</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 157</bibl>; 8, 1 and 5.—Hence, transf., <pb n="424" /> <cb n="CONN" /> <hi rend="ital">a union</hi> or <hi rend="ital">alliance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae haec est conjuratio! utin omnes mulieres eadem aeque studeant nolintque omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:70" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 70 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10362.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A levy</hi> en masse, <hi rend="ital">an enlistment of the whole people</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 614</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10362.4" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a conspiracy, plot</hi> (in good prose; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in the histt.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 1</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">si omnia facienda sunt, quae amici velint: non amicitiae tales, sed conjurationes putandae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 10, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convicti adversum se conjurationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuratio nefanda in omne facinus ac libidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 38, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10362.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concr.), <hi rend="ital">the confederacy, the band of conspirators</hi> themselves: <cit><quote lang="la">perditorum hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conjuratus: <entryFree id="n10363" type="main" key="conju_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjūrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-jūrāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <sense id="n10363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, v. conjuro.</sense></entryFree>
conjuro: <entryFree id="n10364" type="main" key="conju_ro_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjūrō</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (<sense id="n10364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part</hi>. conjuratus in <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> sense; v. II. infra), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a., to swear together</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">one with another, to band or combine together by an oath</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10364.1" n="I" level="1"> In a good sense (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">simul omne tumultu Conjurat trepido Latium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 5</bibl></cit> Serv.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi inter sese decuriati equites ... conjurabant sese fugae ergo non abituros, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 38, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 25, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Trojam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—And in a Greek constr.: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecia conjurata tuas rumpere nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 7</bibl></cit> (cf. under II.): <cit><quote lang="la">inter nos conjuravimus, ego cum illo et ille mecum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: equites Romanos conjurasse omnes, ut transitionem facerent, Auct. B. Hisp. 26.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ab omnibus in legem Dei conjuraretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 8, 8</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp., of the milit. oath, taken at enlistment: senatus consultum, ut omnes juniores Italiae conjurarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 1</bibl></cit> Doberenzad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">milites sociique navales conjurati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina conjurata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 150</bibl></cit>.—Honce, </sense><sense id="n10364.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf. to inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuratae sequuntur Mille rates, for conjuratorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10364.3" n="(b)" level="5"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to unite, be united</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(studium, ingenium): alterius sic Altera poscit opem res et conjurat amice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurati venti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 98</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. Get. 49</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10364.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to assent to by an oath</hi>: quae jurat, mens est: nil conjuravimus illa, Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 135</bibl> (v the pass. in connection).—</sense><sense id="n10364.5" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to form a conspiracy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plot, to conspire</hi> (very freq.): tu verbis conceptis conjuravisti sciens sciente animo tuo, P. Afric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl> (7), 11, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo in omne flagitium et facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 16, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in facinora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Philippi caedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum totā Italiā pro partibus suis (sc. Antonii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl></cit>: in mortem patris, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 25, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra populum Romanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de interficiendo Cn. Pompeio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 24, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (tecta) incendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut urbem incenderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 45, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quaestio de iis habeatur, qui coierint conjurarintve, quo stuprum flagitiumve inferretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 14, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cupiam conjurare, si quisquam recipiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—In a Gr. constr. with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam incendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 24</bibl></cit> Kritz; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum rescindere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 280</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">conjū-rāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">conspirators</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10364.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., of inanim, things: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurata arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 763</bibl></cit> (cf. supra, I. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">Ister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 497</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conjux: <entryFree id="n10365" type="main" key="conjux"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conjux</orth>, v. conjunx.</entryFree>
conl: <entryFree id="n10366" type="main" key="conl"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>. Words thus beginning, v. under coll-.</entryFree>
conm: <entryFree id="n10367" type="main" key="conm"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>. Words thus beginning, v. under comm-.</entryFree>
connascor: <entryFree id="n10368" type="main" key="connascor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-nascor</orth>, <itype>nātus sum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep, to be born at the same time, to be born with</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ET (QVI) CONNATVS FVERIT DE CONIVGE MEA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5013</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10368.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to arise together with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laus nobilitatis connascitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia connata in corpore,</quote> <trans><tr>innate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">connātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = gemellus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5013</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
connecto: <entryFree id="n10369" type="main" key="connecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-necto</orth>, v. conecto.</entryFree>
connexio: <entryFree id="n10370" type="main" key="connexi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">connexĭo, connexīvus, connex-us</orth>, etc., v. conex-.</entryFree>
connitor: <entryFree id="n10371" type="main" key="conni_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">connītor</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">connīvĕo</orth>, etc., v. coni-. <cb n="CONQ" /></entryFree>
connubialis: <entryFree id="n10372" type="main" key="connu_bi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">connūbĭālis, connūbĭum, con-nūbĭālĭter</orth>, v. conub-.</entryFree>
connudatus: <entryFree id="n10373" type="hapax" key="connu_da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">connūdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [nudo], <sense id="n10373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wholly naked</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 23, § 77</bibl> dub. (al. nudata).</sense></entryFree>
connumeratio: <entryFree id="n10374" type="main" key="connu^me^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-nŭmĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>connumero</etym>, <sense id="n10374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reckoning together</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1138</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
connumero: <entryFree id="n10375" type="main" key="connu^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-nŭmĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to number with</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">to reckon among</hi> (post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem inter liberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virum heroicis ingeniis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum connumeratis et dicitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 187</bibl></cit>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 2, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
connus: <entryFree id="n10376" type="main" key="Connus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Connus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek lute-player, who taught Socrates music</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conon: <entryFree id="n10377" type="main" key="Co^no_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏnōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (Gr. <case>acc.</case> Conona, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 1</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ko/nwn</foreign>. <sense id="n10377.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A renowned general of the Athenians, whose life was written by Nepos;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 32, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:5 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 5 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1" default="NO">6, 1</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n10377.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated mathematician and astronomer of Samos in the time of Ptolemy Philadelphus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 738</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
