conopeum: <entryFree id="n10378" type="greek" key="co_no_pe_^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnōpē^um</orth> (instead of a short <sense id="n10378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">e</hi>, sometimes <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnōpĭum</orth>), <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">=</orth> <foreign lang="greek">kwnwpei=on</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a net of fine gauze, used originally by the Egyptians, especially about the bed, as a protection against gnats</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">mosquito-curtains</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cōnōpēum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cōnōpĕum (cōnōpĭum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:16" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 16</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 11, 45. In a doubtful measure, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 8</bibl>.—Hence, Engl. <hi rend="ital">canopy</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
conor: <entryFree id="n10379" type="main" key="co_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to undertake, endeavor, attempt, try, venture, presume</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. molior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 19, 54</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. perficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 30, 105</bibl></cit>); constr. with <hi rend="ital">acc., inf.</hi>, rarely with <case>abl.</case> of the gerund., or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10379.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc</hi>. (mostly of indef. objects): <cit><quote lang="la">quicquam fallaciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus magnum et arduum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod conantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 30, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 82</bibl>: tantum scelus, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 30</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:59:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 59, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muita stulte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima frustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 398</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10379.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 20, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 19, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me labefactare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtas attingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus pangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueris absinthia dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:936" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 936</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 12 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere id quod constituerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invito transire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:116:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 116, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 19</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10379.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> gerundii: <cit><quote lang="la">ne frustra dehortando impedire conemini,</quote> <trans><tr>that you attempt not vainly to dissuade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10379.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepius noctu, si perrumpere possent, conati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8, 4</bibl></cit>. —（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum moliuntur (mulieres), dum conantur, annus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conari manibus pedibus noctisque et dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conantibus, priusquam id effici posset, adesse Romanos nuntiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui prius cogitare quam conari consuesset,</quote> <trans><tr>before he proceeded to the undertaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego obviam conabar tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audax ad conandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 23, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10379.5" n="b" level="4"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, in <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>. signif., <hi rend="ital">an undertaking, attempt, venture, hazard</hi> (class.), Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 202, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 386</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:50:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 50, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 420</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 755</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:210" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 210</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:35:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 35, 5</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
conp: <entryFree id="n10380" type="main" key="conp"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conp-</orth>, v. comp-.</entryFree>
conquadro: <entryFree id="n10381" type="main" key="conqua_^dro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-quā^dro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (very rare). <sense id="n10381.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to make square</hi>: aurum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 131, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perticas (just before: dolare in quadrum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10381.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to be proportioned to, to agree with, to square to</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
conquaero: <entryFree id="n10382" type="main" key="conquaero"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conquaero</orth>, v. conquiro.</entryFree>
conquaestor: <entryFree id="n10383" type="main" key="conquaestor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conquaestor</orth>, v. conquisitor.</entryFree>
conquassatio: <entryFree id="n10384" type="hapax" key="conquassa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conquassātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conquasso</etym>, <sense id="n10384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a severe shaking, a shattering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conquassatio et perturbatio totius valetudinis corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conquasso: <entryFree id="n10385" type="main" key="conquasso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-quasso</orth>, no <sense id="n10385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10385.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To shake severely</hi> (several times in Lucr. <cb n="CONQ" /> and Cic., elsewh. very rare; after Cic. only in late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n10385.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus ex aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia graviter terrarum motibus ortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 107</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Appulia maximis terrae motibus conquassata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 43, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 14, 6, § 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10385.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shatter, disturb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conquassatur enim tum mens animaeque potestas (corresp. with collabefieri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 599</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exteras nationes illius anni furore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:26:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 26, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: omnes provincias, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 4</bibl>: aliquem maximis periculis, Firm. Math. 3, 13, 4.—* </sense><sense id="n10385.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To shatter, dash to pieces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calicem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 52, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conquaterno: <entryFree id="n10386" type="gloss" key="conqua^terno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-quăterno</orth>, <sense id="n10386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to yoke by fours</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">zeugi/zw kata\ te/ssara</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
conqueror: <entryFree id="n10387" type="main" key="conque^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-quĕror</orth>, <itype>questus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">to complain of a thing</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to bewail, lament passionately</hi> or <hi rend="ital">much</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10387.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: conqueri fortunam adversam non lamentari decet, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 50</bibl>: res suas adversum illum (mulier), Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 232, 22</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunas suas mecum (mulier),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decumarum imperia, bonorum direptiones, iniqua judicia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:50:section=111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 50, § 111</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vim atque injuriam dictatoris apud patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 33, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:5" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 53, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:24:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 24, 6 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 31, 50</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 54</bibl> <hi rend="ital">bis;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:54" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:243 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 243 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid pro re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10387.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se dissolvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 612</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10387.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de alicujus improbitate deplorare et conqueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de alicujus injuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti conquereretur, cur Pisonem aditu arceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberio de eādem re ... apud se per epistulam conquerenti ita rescripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos apud se de collegarum judicio fuisse conquestos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 53:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 53, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10387.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliā voce ac res monebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conquerar an sileam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego ignaris nequiquam conqueror auris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:94" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 94</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postero die in senatu conquestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conquestio: <entryFree id="n10388" type="main" key="conquesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conquestĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conqueror</etym>, <sense id="n10388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a violent complaining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bewailing, complaint</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n10388.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n10388.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla, nullum auxilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:7:section=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 7, § 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 39, 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa adversus omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa de bellis civilibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorum praeteritorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78, 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10388.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in rhet.: <cit><quote lang="la">conquestio est oratio auditorum misericordiam captans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:55:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 55, 106</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 52, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 13, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10388.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the plaintive notes of birds, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 33, § 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conquestus: <entryFree id="n10389" type="main" key="conquestus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conquestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from conqueror.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10390" type="main" key="conquestus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conquestus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>conqueror</etym>, <sense id="n10390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a violent complaint</hi> (very rare, and only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:291" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 291</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 399</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conquiesco: <entryFree id="n10391" type="main" key="conqui^esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-quĭesco</orth>, <itype>quĭēvi, quĭētum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n10391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> sync. conquiesti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conquierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>, n. 34; 7, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.; inf.</hi> conquiesse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 13, 12</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. n., to be wholly at rest, to rest, take rest, to repose</hi> (in good prose; most freq. in Cic., esp. in the transf. and trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n10391.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to rest, be at rest, to cease from exertion, to be idle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inactive, to be in repose</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10391.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10391.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">videmus igitur, ut conquiescere ne infantes quidem possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 26, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(in Tusculano) ex omnibus molestiis et laboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante iter confectum,</quote> <trans><tr>to take rest, to halt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenem instigat, nec conquiescere ipsa potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 13, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non concoxit, ex toto conquiescere (debet), ac neque labori se, neque exercitationi, neque negotiis credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10391.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex omnibus molestiis et laboribus uno illo in loco conquiescimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a continuis bellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10391.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of sleep, <hi rend="ital">to take repose, take a nap</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meridie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 46</bibl></cit>: paulisper post cibum meridianum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl>.—Hence, prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">de istac re in oculum utrumvis conquiescito,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>you may be entirely easy, unconcerned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 121</bibl></cit> (cf. auris, I. A.).—</sense><sense id="n10391.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To give the voice rest, pause</hi> (in speaking): no tatur enim maxime similitudo in conquiescendo,<pb n="425" /> <cb n="CONQ" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 191</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10391.7" n="3" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to pause, stop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam furiam pestemque ... nec conquiesse, donec ipsa manibus suis nefaria sibi arma adversus hospitem indueret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 13, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quia tu nisi perfectā re de me non conquiesti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profecto numquam conquiescam neque defatigabor ante, quam illorum vias percepero, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:36:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 36, 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10391.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10391.9" n="A" level="2"> Of inanimate and abstract things as subjects, <hi rend="ital">to stop, pause, rest, be quiet, to be at rest, be in repose</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quando illius postea sica conquievit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 14, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigatio mercatorum,</quote> <trans><tr>is stopped, closed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae, nisi quid novi exstiterit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non manes, non stirps (ejus viri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbre conquiescente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia bella jure gentium conquiescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Italia a delectu, urbs ab armis sine Milonis clade numquam esset conquietura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:25:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 25, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manes a posterorum execrationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:53" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In medic. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">febris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflammatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 26, 21 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10391.10" n="B" level="2"> (Cf. acquiesco, II.) <hi rend="ital">To enjoy entire repose, to find rest, recreation, pleasure in something</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10391.11" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">habebam, quo confugerem, ubi conquiescerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nocte nec interdiu virum conquiescere pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec conquiescere socios vestros posse, quoad regia Pergami sit,</quote> <trans><tr>be at peace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 42, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi aures convicio defessae conquiescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitio non patitur quemquam in eādem mensurā honorum conquiescere, quā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:27:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 27, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10391.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nostris studiis libentissime conquiescimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in amore atque in adulescentiā tuā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amici mutuā benevolentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 6, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conquinisco: <entryFree id="n10392" type="main" key="conqui^nisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-quĭnisco</orth>, <itype>quexi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>quino, kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">kine/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n10392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cower down, squat, stoop down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 84, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput inclinare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 885</bibl></cit> P. (only ante-class. in the foll. exs.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 75</bibl>: ad eum conquexi, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1</bibl>. 1. (Com. Rel. v. 171 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
conquiro: <entryFree id="n10393" type="main" key="conqui_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conquīro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-quaero</orth>), <itype>quīsīvi</itype> (arch. form CONQVAESEIVEI in inscrr.: <sense id="n10393.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">conquisierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 15</bibl>), <itype>quīsītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>quaero</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to seelc</hi> or <hi rend="ital">search for, to procure, bring together, collect</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the histt.). </sense><sense id="n10393.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10393.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves toto flumine Ibero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lisso Parthinisque et omnibus castellis quod esset frumenti conquiri jussit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (cornua) studiose conquisita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam plurimum domiti pecoris ex agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 75:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 75, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea (sc. obsides, arma, servos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27</bibl></cit> and 28: <cit><quote lang="la">socios ad eum interficiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dona ac pecunias acerbe per municipia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conquirere et comburere vaticinos libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desertores de exercitu volonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 7, 5</bibl></cit> Duker: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines sibi undique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgo amantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabros undique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:137:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 137, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10393.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to seek after, search for, go in quest of, to make search for</hi> (esp. freq. in Cic. and Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">conquisita diu dulcique reperta labore carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavitates undique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 96</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conquirere et comparare voluptatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 27, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetera exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piacula irae deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solacia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae primas causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes artes ad opprimendum eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10393.4" n="II" level="1"> Esp. (con intens.), <hi rend="ital">to seek for with earnestness, to search out eagerly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n10393.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diodorum tota provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:19:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 19, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Liberam) investigare et conquirere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit>, § 106: terrā marique conquiri, Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conquirere consulem et sepelire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 52, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum ad necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:41:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 41, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10393.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid sceleris et flagitii,</quote> <trans><tr>to seek to commit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 96</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">conquīsītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">sought out, chosen, costly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conquisiti atque electi coloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 96</bibl></cit>: peregrina et conquisita medicamenta,<cb n="CONS" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 23</bibl>: figurae (opp. obviae dicenti), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae conquisitissimis epulis exstruebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 62</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> prob. not in use.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">conquīsītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">carefully, with much pains</hi> (ante- and post-class., and only in <hi rend="ital">posit.</hi>): conquisite commercata edulia, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 28, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conquisite admodum scripsit Varro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conquisite conscripsimus (corresp. with diligenter),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 31, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conquisite: <entryFree id="n10394" type="main" key="conqui_si_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conquīsītē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. conquiro, <sense id="n10394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
conquisitio: <entryFree id="n10395" type="main" key="conqui_si_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conquīsītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conquiro</etym>, <sense id="n10395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seeking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">search for, a bringing together, procuring, collecting</hi> (rare, but in good prose). </sense><sense id="n10395.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sacrorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficillimum est in omni conquisitione rationis exordium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piaculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10395.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a levying, levy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:32:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 32, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intentissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:35:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 35, 10 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
conquisitor: <entryFree id="n10396" type="main" key="conqui_si_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conquīsītor</orth> (access. form in Plaut. <orth extent="full" lang="la">conquistor</orth>; or, acc. to Lachm., <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-quaestor</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n10396.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a recruiting officer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 25, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10396.1" n="II" level="1"> In a theatre, <hi rend="ital">a claqueur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 65</bibl> and 82.</sense></entryFree>
conquisitus: <entryFree id="n10397" type="main" key="conqui_si_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conquīsītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>conquiro</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
conquistor: <entryFree id="n10398" type="main" key="conquistor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conquistor</orth>, v. conquisitor.</entryFree>
conr: <entryFree id="n10399" type="main" key="conr"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conr</orth>. Words thus beginning, v. under corr.</entryFree>
consabrum: <entryFree id="n10400" type="main" key="Consabrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Consabrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n10400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">south of Toletum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Consuegra</hi>, Itin. Anton. p. 446.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Con-saburensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Consabrum</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 402, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">909, 14</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Con-saburenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Consabrum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:5:19" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 5, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consacerdos: <entryFree id="n10401" type="main" key="consa^cerdos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-săcerdos</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <sense id="n10401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comm., a fellowpriest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">priesless</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:74 al" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 74 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
consacro: <entryFree id="n10402" type="main" key="consa_^cro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consā^cro</orth>, v. consecro.</entryFree>
consaep: <entryFree id="n10403" type="main" key="consaep"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consaep-</orth>, v. consep-.</entryFree>
consaepio: <entryFree id="n10404" type="main" key="consaepi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-saepĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-sēpĭo</orth>), no <sense id="n10404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, saeptum (consiptum, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=62:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 62, 10</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:ib. 64:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 64, 6</bibl>, and <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), 4, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to fence round, hedge in</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10404.1" n="I" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">verb finit</hi>. (rare): bustum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 33</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n10404.2" n="II" level="1"> More freq., </sense><sense id="n10404.3" n="A" level="2"> In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-saeptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">enclosed, hedged in</hi>: consaeptus ager et diligenter consitus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 17, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus cratibus pluteisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus saxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:57:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 57, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10404.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: teneor consipta, undique venor, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 183, 14</bibl> (in acc. with Euripides, <foreign lang="greek">*kakw=s pe/praktai pantaxh=</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n10404.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-saeptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fence, hedge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:1" default="NO">1, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 38, 12</bibl>: fori, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10404.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus animam consaepto suo obstruit, Tert. Anim. c. 53: cordis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 136, 6 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
consaepto: <entryFree id="n10405" type="hapax" key="consaepto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consaepto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-septo</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>consaepio</etym>, <sense id="n10405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fence round, hedge in, enclose</hi>: animalia in sacro lucu, Sol. c. 32, § 37.</sense></entryFree>
consaeptum: <entryFree id="n10406" type="main" key="consaeptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consaeptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. consaepio, II. B.</entryFree>
consaeptus: <entryFree id="n10407" type="main" key="consaeptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consaeptus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>consaepio</etym>, <sense id="n10407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hedging in, fencing round</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:32" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 32</bibl> Zumpt (al. in conspectu).</sense></entryFree>
consalutatio: <entryFree id="n10408" type="main" key="consa^lu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consălūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consaluto</etym>, <sense id="n10408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a greeting</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">of several, a mutual salutation</hi> (rare; mostly post-Aug.), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consaluto: <entryFree id="n10409" type="main" key="consa^lu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sălūto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to greet, salute cordially</hi>, in gen. (in good prose; esp. freq. in the histt. after the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n10409.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque regem (sua multitudo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:7:7" default="NO">10, 7, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10409.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With two <hi rend="ital">accs., to greet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">salute as, to hail</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">eum regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum dictatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 26, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem imperatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem Caesarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 86 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem patrem patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum Latiarem Jovem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eam Volumniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 24, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10409.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum inter se ... amicissime consalutassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus consalutant,</quote> <trans><tr>one another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:3:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>. <cb n="CONS" /></sense></entryFree>
consanesco: <entryFree id="n10410" type="main" key="consa_nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sānesco</orth>, <itype>nŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch., to become whole</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sound, to be healed</hi> (rare): etiam illa, quae consanuisse videbantur, recrudescunt, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 2</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:27:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 27, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:3" default="NO">8, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 10</bibl> pr.</sense></entryFree>
consanguineus: <entryFree id="n10411" type="main" key="consangui^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sanguĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<sense id="n10411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> consanguineūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 73</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">adj., springing from the same blood, related by blood</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10411.1" n="I" level="1"> In a restricted sense, of brothers and sisters, <hi rend="ital">brotherly, sisterly</hi> (so mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 14, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:407" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angues,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>born with her, kindred</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 2, 237</bibl></cit>.—Of animals: arietes, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 44</bibl> (Praetext. v. 21 Rib.). —Of abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">caritas ( = benevolentia fraterna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:407" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 407</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consanguĭnĕ-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a brother</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 23, 3</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">consanguĭnĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sister</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 118</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n10411.2" n="II" level="1"> In a more gen. sense, <hi rend="ital">related, kindred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Turnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:608" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 608</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:655" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 655</bibl></cit>. —Esp. freq. as <hi rend="ital">subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consanguĭ-nĕi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">kindred, relations</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:24:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 24, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 25</bibl>.—General senses, <hi rend="ital">related, kindred</hi> (so most freq. in prose and poetry), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1282" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1282</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:16:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 16, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10411.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consanguineus Leti Sopor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 278</bibl></cit> (in acc. with Hom. Il. <foreign lang="greek">c</foreign>, 231: <foreign lang="greek">*u(/pnos kasi/gnhtos *qana/toio</foreign>).—* </sense><sense id="n10411.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">res rustica proxima et quasi consanguinea sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 4.</sense></entryFree>
consanguinitas: <entryFree id="n10412" type="main" key="consangui^ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consanguĭnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consanguineus</etym>, <sense id="n10412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blood-relationship, consanguinity</hi> (rare; perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n10412.1" n="I" level="1"> In a restricted sense, <hi rend="ital">the relationship between brothers</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sisters</hi> (mostly in the jurists), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:8:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:44" default="NO">1, 7, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10412.2" n="II" level="1"> In a more extended sense, <hi rend="ital">relationship</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 19, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 86</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10412.3" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: doctrinae, <hi rend="ital">affinity, similarity</hi>, Tert. adv. Haeret. c. 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consano: <entryFree id="n10413" type="main" key="consa_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sāno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to make wholly sound, to heal, cure</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cicatricem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 24, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitum abscissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 10</bibl></cit> pr.</sense></entryFree>
consarcino: <entryFree id="n10414" type="main" key="consarci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sarcĭno</orth>, no <sense id="n10414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to sew, stitch</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">patch together</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n10414.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">indumenta ex pellibus silvestrium murium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10414.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:19" default="NO">13, 24, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina multa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consarrio: <entryFree id="n10415" type="main" key="consarri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sarrĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-sārĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n10415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to hoe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rake to pieces</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">stercus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 48, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcos omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:46" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consatio: <entryFree id="n10416" type="main" key="consa^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consătĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <sense id="n10416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [1. consero], <hi rend="ital">a procreation</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">concubitales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consatus: <entryFree id="n10417" type="main" key="consa^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consătus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. consero.</entryFree>
consaucio: <entryFree id="n10418" type="main" key="consauci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-saucĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to wound severely</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">caput praetoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus crebro vulnere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 19, 26</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> of <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crus et utrumque bracchium ruinā pontis consauciatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consavio: <entryFree id="n10419" type="main" key="consa_vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consāvĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">consāvĭor</orth>, v. consuav-.</entryFree>
consceleratus: <entryFree id="n10420" type="main" key="consce^le^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conscĕlĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>conscelero</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
conscelero: <entryFree id="n10421" type="main" key="consce^le^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-scĕlĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to stain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pollute with guilt, to dishonor, disgrace by wicked conduct;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">verb finit</hi>. (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos videndo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures paternas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscelerati contaminatique ab ludis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 37, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">conscĕlĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., wicked, depraved</hi> (very freq., esp. in Cicero's orations): <cit><quote lang="la">pirata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:35:section=90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 35, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res ... captisque magis mentibus quam consceleratis similis visa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 18, 11</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsectio linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:67:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 67, 191</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 7, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">conscĕlĕrātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a wicked person, a villain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in inpios et consceleratos poenae certissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tuā consceleratorum ac perditorum manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> not in use.</sense></entryFree>
conscendo: <entryFree id="n10422" type="main" key="conscendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-scendo</orth>, <itype>ndi, nsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <pb n="426" /> <cb n="CONS" /> [scando]. <sense id="n10422.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to mount, to ascend</hi> (in prose rare before the Aug. per.) </sense><sense id="n10422.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10422.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">currum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 18, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:10:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 10, 12</bibl>: montes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:820" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 820</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aethera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 299</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:7" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:444" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 444</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">culmen summum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:510" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 646</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 10 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10422.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in equi costas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in montem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 116, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10422.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">laudis carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 10, 23: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ultimum nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 377" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 377</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10422.5" n="II" level="1"> Esp., a nautical t. t., <hi rend="ital">to go on board a ship, to embark, take ship</hi>, etc. (class. in all periods and species of composition; cf. ascendo); constr. with the <hi rend="ital">acc., in</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10422.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: cymbam piscatoriam. Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 535, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 19, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 11, 8</bibl>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscensā nave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:4:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">navibus conscensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:10:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavatum ex materiā alveum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:107:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 107, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:95" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 155</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 422</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor navibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to navigate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 381</bibl></cit>: ibi classem, Auct. B. Afr. 10, 2.— </sense><sense id="n10422.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in phaselum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10422.8" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim quam primum conscendas ad meque venias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 4 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscende nobiscum, et quidem ad puppim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 19, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 11, 10</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Siciliam,</quote> <trans><tr>to embark for Sicily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 29, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case> of place: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium a Brundisio conscendisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eo loco conscendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hortis Cluvianis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Epheso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thessalonicae conscendere jussi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 23, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conscensio: <entryFree id="n10423" type="main" key="conscensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conscensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conscendo</etym>, <sense id="n10423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ascending into, embarking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 32, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conscensus: <entryFree id="n10424" type="main" key="conscensus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conscensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from conscendo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10425" type="main" key="conscensus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conscensus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>conscendo</etym>, <sense id="n10425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ascending, mounting</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Hilar. Trin. 1, 20; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Ep. 2, § 17</bibl> Halm.</sense></entryFree>
conscientia: <entryFree id="n10426" type="main" key="consci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conscĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conscio</etym>, <sense id="n10426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a knowing of a thing together with another person, joint knowledge, consciousness</hi> (in good prose, and very freq.). </sense><sense id="n10426.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A joint knowledge of something, a being privy to, a knowing along with others, privity, cognizance</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10426.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium horum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberti unius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:56 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 56 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">generis humani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10426.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi> (thus for the most part in Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">in conscientiam facinoris pauci asciti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia conscientiaeque ejus modi facinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 20, 56</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10426.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo eos persequi, ad quos maxime culpa corrupti judicii, sed etiam illos, ad quos conscientiae contagio pertinebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:71:section=183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 71, § 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non modo a facti verum etiam a conscientiae suspitione afuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte perfugit Tanagram, suam conscientiam metuens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 28, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1,
