31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10426.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Consciousness, knowledge, feeling, sense</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10426.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rare). </sense><sense id="n10426.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde haec illis tanta modestia, nisi a conscientiā virium et nostrarum et suarum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 4, 10</bibl></cit> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">contracti culpā periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae infirmitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebellionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">defectionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unionum in somno quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 12, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amissae fortunae,</quote> <trans><tr>a recollection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:12:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa pulcherrimi facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officii mei benevolentiaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum tuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 17, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:3:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 19, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 20, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te conscientiae stimulant maleficiorum tuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. under B. 2.—* </sense><sense id="n10426.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: satisfactionem ex nullà conscientiā de culpā proponere decrevi, Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 35, 2</bibl>; cf. conscius, I. <foreign lang="greek">d</foreign>— </sense><sense id="n10426.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">illi conscientia, quid abesset virium, detrectavere pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 60, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 19, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10426.10" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: ut <cb n="CONS" /> nostram stabilem conscientiam contemnamus, aliorum errantem opinionem aucupemur, <hi rend="ital">self-consciousness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud se tacere suam conscientiam non pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in veris quoque sufficit conscientia,</quote> <trans><tr>consciousness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: sine hac quidem conscientiā ipsa illa ex tempore dicendi facultas inanem modo loquacitatem dabit, <hi rend="ital">without this feeling</hi>, equiv. to <hi rend="ital">without this persuasion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis capite defectionis ablato manebat plerisque militum conscientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.— So pregn., with <hi rend="ital">ne, a conscientious fear, guilty fear</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10426.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a consciousness of right</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wrong, the moral sense, conscience</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna vis est conscientiae ... in utramque partem, ut neque timeant qui nihil commiserint et poenam semper ante oculos versari putent qui peccarint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 23, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et virtutis et vitiorum grave ipsius conscientiae pondus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:35:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 35, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona conscientia turbam advocat, mala etiam in solitudine anxia atque sollicita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 43:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 43, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad purgandam publicam conscientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:4:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recta,</quote> <trans><tr>a good conscience</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 20, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">egregia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:33:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 33, 9</bibl></cit>: bona, Cels. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:93" default="NO">9, 2, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">optima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvā bonā conscientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">15: integra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:1:9:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 19, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <trans><tr>a bad conscience</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 62, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 10.—* </sense><sense id="n10426.12" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">conscientia mille testes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 41</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10426.13" n="2" level="3"> Sometimes <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> for <hi rend="ital">a good</hi>, or for <hi rend="ital">a bad conscience</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10426.14" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A good conscience</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea mihi conscientia pluris est quam omnium sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 28, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illud est hominis magni ... maximi aestimare conscientiam mentis suae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:58:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 58, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus ego nec dissentire a nostris salvā gratiā nec consentire salvā conscientiā possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sacrificium integrā conscientiā venire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 19, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:9:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 9, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10426.15" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A bad conscience</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc tu quas conscientiae labes in animo censes habuisse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 21, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 14, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 35, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 46</bibl>.—In the same sense: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3, prol. 47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, prol. 47</bibl>; and in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae (quemque) malae cogitationes conscientiaeque animi terrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conscindo: <entryFree id="n10427" type="main" key="conscindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-scindo</orth>, <itype>ĭdi, issum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to tear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rend to pieces</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n10427.1" n="I" level="1"> Lit: <cit><quote lang="la">pallulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsam capillo for illius capillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.—</sense><sense id="n10427.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā dominus, quā advocati sibilis conscissi,</quote> <trans><tr>hissed at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: is me ab optimatibus ait conscindi, <hi rend="ital">am pulled to pieces</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">abused, calumniated</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 16, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conscio: <entryFree id="n10428" type="main" key="consci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-scĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> * <sense id="n10428.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be conscious</hi> of wrong: nil sibi, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10428.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To know well</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">consciens Christus, quid esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conscisco: <entryFree id="n10429" type="main" key="conscisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-scisco</orth>, <itype>scīvi or scĭi, scītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n10429.0" n="I" level="1"> Publicists' t. t., <hi rend="ital">to approve of, decree, determine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">resolve upon something in common</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi jussa vetita quom suffragio consciscentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Senatus populi Romani Quiritium censuit, consensit, conscivit ut bellum cum priscis Latinis fieret, etc. (an old formula for the declaration of war),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tusci fere omnes consciverant bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>had decided upon, decreed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communi consilio fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 34, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus in se ac suos foedum ac ferum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 22, 5</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 9</bibl></cit> (not consistere; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 349</bibl>).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10429.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> from the sphere of state affairs; <hi rend="ital">aliquid sibi</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> lit., <hi rend="ital">to adjudge, appropriate to one's self</hi> (cf. ascisco); hence, with the access. idea of personal action, <hi rend="ital">to inflict</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring upon one's self</hi> (most frequently death;—class.). </sense><sense id="n10429.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">sibi</hi>: letum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <trans><tr>to kill one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:61:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 61, 171</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:56:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 56, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 11, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 34, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 31, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; Nep. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:18:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 18, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 36, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilium ac fugam,</quote> <trans><tr>to go into voluntary exile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 53, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10429.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <hi rend="ital">sibi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">letum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 31</bibl></cit>, n. 3: fugam, <hi rend="ital">to flee</hi>, <cb n="CONS" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 34, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:48:10" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 48, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:17:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consciscenda mors voluntaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de consciscendā nece cogitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nece conscitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 107</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 11, 1</bibl>, conscierunt is a false read. for consentiunt or conspirant; cf. Nipperd. Spicil. ap. Corn. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:page=37 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> p. 37 sq.</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
conscissio: <entryFree id="n10430" type="hapax" key="conscissi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conscissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conscindo</etym>, <sense id="n10430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tearing in pieces</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mor. Eccl. Cath. 34" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mor. Eccl. Cath. 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conscissus: <entryFree id="n10431" type="main" key="conscissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conscissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from conscindo.</entryFree>
conscitus: <entryFree id="n10432" type="main" key="consci_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conscītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from conscisco.</entryFree>
conscius: <entryFree id="n10433" type="main" key="consci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-scĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scio</etym>, <sense id="n10433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that knows something in company with others</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by himself, knowing with others</hi> or <hi rend="ital">self-knowing</hi> (freq. in all periods and species of composition). </sense><sense id="n10433.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Knowing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conscious of something with another, privy to;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, a (male or female) <hi rend="ital">participant in a thing, an accessory, accomplice, confidant</hi>, etc.; constr. with the <hi rend="ital">gen., dat., in</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">de aliquā re</hi>, an <hi rend="ital">obj.-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (cf. Rudd. II. p. 71). </sense><sense id="n10433.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> with or without <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> infra): <cit><quote lang="la">qui tam audacis facinoris mi conscius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alius alii tanti facinoris conscii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si conscius Dymno tanti sceleris fuissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 20</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum tot flagitiorum exercitui meo conscius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Pomponius, homo omnium meorum in te studiorum et officiorum maxime conscius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">maleficii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:22:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 22, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante actae vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmitatis nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interficiendi Postumi Agrippae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesarianae necis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and necis (opp. auctor),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccati erilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjutores quosdam, conscios sui ( = sui consilii) nactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:108:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 108, 2</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva versi regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 385</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum nox conscia sola est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fati sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:265 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 265 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10433.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic facinori tanto tua mens liberalis conscia esse non debuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 21, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritati et mendacio meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:56:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 56, § 124</bibl></cit> (quoted in Arus. Mess. p. 220 Lind.): <cit><quote lang="la">Fabricium quem ... conscium illi facinori fuisse arbitrabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:20:56 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 20, 56 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:41" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coeptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 194</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacris nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 588</bibl></cit> Heins.: <cit><quote lang="la">deliciis meis antra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conubiis aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 168</bibl></cit> Wagn. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens nascenti conscia Nilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10433.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi in privatis omnibus conscius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">conscius vestris in lacrimis adfueram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:10:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10433.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">addit ad extremum, se audisse a Curione his de rebus conscium esse Pisonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 24, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. conscientia, II. A. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis consciis quae gereretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mihi conscius est ullus homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 40</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fac me consciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 24, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 29</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera nox et nos et turris conscia novit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:65:24 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 65, 24 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">conscĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, of those who are participants in a crime, conspiracy, etc., <hi rend="ital">a partaker, jointconspirator, accessory, accomplice, confidant</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:81" default="NO">9, 2, 81</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consciorum nomina exponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Othonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:39 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 39 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (sacerdotes Germanorum) ministros deorum, illos (equos) conscios putant (sc. deorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10433.6" n="II" level="1"> With <hi rend="ital">sibi, knowing something in one's self, conscious of</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10433.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., in a good and bad sense. </sense><sense id="n10433.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (sc. populus Romanus) si alicujus injuriae sibi conscius fuisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sibi nullius culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:18:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 18, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi dissimulati in ullā parte judicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi irae et iracundiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis adversus majestatem tuam habiti nullius conscii sumus nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens sibi recti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 604</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">without sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:311" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admissae nequitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:38" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacis facti (lupus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:812" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 812</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10433.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi factis mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1018" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1018</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10433.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuila sibi turpi in re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 393</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10433.11" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 50</bibl>: etsi mihi sum conscius, numquam<pb n="427" /> <cb n="CONS" />  me nimis cupidum fuisse vitae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 8</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi>- or <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sibi conscius esset, quam inimicum deberet Caesarem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:44" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—With <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres male sibi consciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:5:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego pol, quae mihi sum conscia, hoc certo scio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscia mens ut cuique sua est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:485" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 485</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 668</bibl></cit>.— Constrr. analogous to the Greek: conscius sum mihi benefacienti and benefaciens (<foreign lang="greek">su/noida e)mautw=| pepoihko/ti</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">poiw=n</foreign>), are mentioned by <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1205</bibl> P., as much used earlier, but without exs. in proof.— </sense><sense id="n10433.12" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">conscious to one's self of wrong</hi> (rare, and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est miserius quam animus hominis conscius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 496" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 496</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 692" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 692</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conscreor: <entryFree id="n10434" type="main" key="conscre^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conscrĕor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n10434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to clear the voice, hawk much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnifice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 479, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conscribillo: <entryFree id="n10435" type="main" key="conscri_billo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conscrībillo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dim. a.</hi> [conscribo], <hi rend="ital">to scribble over, to scribble, scrawl upon</hi> (very rare; perh. only in the foll. exs.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 82, 30 sq.</bibl> <hi rend="ital">bis.</hi>— <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to mark by beating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nates mollicellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 25, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conscribo: <entryFree id="n10436" type="main" key="conscri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-scrībo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a.;</hi> lit., <hi rend="ital">to write together</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n10436.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To write together in a roll</hi> or <hi rend="ital">list, to enroll;</hi> very freq. as a milit. t. t., of the levying of troops, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2</bibl>; 2, 8 et saep.; Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 15, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes veteranas tumulti causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter septimanos conscribi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter nostros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscripti in Ciliciam legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum adversum aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—And of the enrolment of colonists: <cit><quote lang="la">decrevit senatus, ut C. Lentulus consul sex milia familiarum conscriberet, quae in eas colonias dividerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:46:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 46, 10</bibl></cit>.—So of enrolling in a particular class of citizens, <hi rend="ital">to inscribe, choose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem tempore et centuriae tres equitum conscriptae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13, 8</bibl></cit>.—So the frequently occurring title of senators: Patres Conscripti (prop. Patres, conscripti, i. e. Patres et conscripti), <hi rend="ital">chosen, elect, assembled fathers</hi> (lit. <hi rend="ital">fathers</hi> and <hi rend="ital">elect</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">traditum inde (sc. post reges exactos) fertur, ut in Senatum vocarentur, qui Patres quique Conscripti essent: Conscriptos videlicet in novum senatum appellabant lectos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=254:22" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 254, 22</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=7:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 7, 5</bibl>, and p. 41, 13 ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:35:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 35, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 52, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 26, 4</bibl>; Dict. of Antiq.; <cit><quote lang="la">and in imitation of this: di conscripti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 182, 35</bibl></cit>.—In a play upon words (censured by Quint.): ne Patres conscripti videantur circumscripti, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 72</bibl>.—Also in <number>sing.</number>, of one senator: <cit><quote lang="la">pater conscriptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 13, 28</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> in <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">conscriptus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a senator</hi>: quod sit conscripti, quod judicis officium, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 314</bibl>.—So also of the enrolling of the people for the purpose of bribery, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 18, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 15, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex me opere oravit maximo ut sibi latrones cogerem et conscriberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10436.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To put together in writing, to draw up, compose, write</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n10436.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum de consulatu, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:35:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 35, 132</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Topica Aristotelea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 19 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:9:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 9, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepidas tabellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 50, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syngraphum inter me et amicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginem,</quote> <trans><tr>to delineate, sketch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:117" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem (consules),</quote> <trans><tr>to draw up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">edicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condiciones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 24, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 12, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 24, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunas alterius litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:66:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 66, 186</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10436.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pluribus conscripsisset, qui esset optimus rei publicae status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit> Madv. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n10436.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(illi), de quibus audivi et legi et ipse conscripsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 11, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ratione dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10436.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: ut in ordinem se coactum conscriberet, <hi rend="ital">write down, notice that he should be</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 38</bibl>: omni personae quam dotem <cb n="CONS" /> suscepisse cum marito conscribitur, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 15, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10436.7" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of physicians, <hi rend="ital">to prescribe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro salutaribus mortifera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10436.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to write something all over, to fill with writing</hi> (rare; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mensam vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: epistolium lacrimis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 2</bibl>.— Humorously, <hi rend="ital">to mark by beating, to cudgel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscribere aliquem totum stilis ulmeis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 132</bibl></cit>; cf. conscribillo.— </sense><sense id="n10436.9" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">abl., to write upon, mark upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum sanguinis id est crucis in suā fronte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 26, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conscriptio: <entryFree id="n10437" type="main" key="conscripti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conscriptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conscribo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n10437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing up in writing, a composing, composition</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n10437.1" n="I" level="1"> In abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">libelli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 18</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n10437.2" n="II" level="1"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">a representation, treatise, writing;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:67:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 67, 191</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7</bibl>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: in annalium conscriptionibus legere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 242</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10437.3" n="III" level="1"> (Conscribo, I.) <hi rend="ital">A levying of troops</hi>, Julian. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> 16</bibl>, Hist. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eccl.</author> 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conscriptor: <entryFree id="n10438" type="main" key="conscriptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conscriptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (post-class.), <sense id="n10438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a composer, writer, author</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 277" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 277</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 33 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 18" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conscriptus: <entryFree id="n10439" type="main" key="conscriptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conscriptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from conscribo.</entryFree>
conseco: <entryFree id="n10440" type="main" key="conse^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sĕco</orth>, <itype>cŭi, ctum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (rare; not in Cic.). <sense id="n10440.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cut up, cut to pieces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassicam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nasturtium minutatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:59:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 59, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra fratris (Medea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:9:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genas,</quote> <trans><tr>to lacerate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 137, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10440.1" n="II" level="1"> In Pliny, <hi rend="ital">to cut off, lop, prune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 43, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncum arboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 10, 9, § 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:193" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 26, 66, § 193</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consecraneus: <entryFree id="n10441" type="main" key="conse_^cra_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consē^crānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>con-sacer</etym>, <sense id="n10441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">united by the same</hi> sacra; only <hi rend="ital">subst., one bound by the same (military) oath</hi> (postclass. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">mei commilitones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noster,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consecratio: <entryFree id="n10442" type="main" key="conse_^cra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consē^crātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consecro</etym>. <sense id="n10442.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A religious dedication, consecration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:40:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 40, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">50, 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 48, 125</bibl></cit>.—Also of the <hi rend="ital">deification</hi> of the Roman emperor, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsae consecrationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20, 24</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of the consecration of a priest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 303, 2</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10442.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An execration</hi>, in laws: <cit><quote lang="la">consecratione legis aut poenae, cum caput ejus, qui contra fecerit, consecratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 14, 33</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10442.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A magical incantation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consecrator: <entryFree id="n10443" type="main" key="conse_^cra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consē^crātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who consecrates</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dedicates</hi> (late Lat.): simulacrorum, Firm. Math. 4, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecclesiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
consecratrix: <entryFree id="n10444" type="main" key="conse_^cra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consē^crātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consecrator</etym>, <sense id="n10444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who consecrates</hi> or <hi rend="ital">makes sacred</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">bovis Aegyptus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consecro: <entryFree id="n10445" type="main" key="conse_^cro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consē^cro</orth> (written CONSACRO in <bibl default="NO"><author>Monum. Ancyr.</author> 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 618 al.</bibl>; <sense id="n10445.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, <pos>P. a.</pos>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sacro</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to dedicate, devote something as sacred to a deity</hi> (class., esp. in prose). </sense><sense id="n10445.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10445.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10445.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">candelabrum dare, donare, dicare, consecrare Jovi Optimo Maximo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:29:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 29, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manubias Martis Musis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam Siciliam Cereri et Liberae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedem Tonanti Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres gladios Marti Ultori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum castrorum Neptuno ac Marti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbam Capitolio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 12</bibl></cit>: hunc lucum tibi (with dedico), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:18:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 18, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10445.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia consecrabantur aedes, non privatorum domicilia, sed quae sacra nominantur, consecrabantur agri ... ut imperator agros de hostibus captos consecraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:49:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 49, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 55, 140</bibl></cit>; 53, 137; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">video etiam consecrata simulacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:24:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 24, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum certis circa terminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucos ac nemora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum Campanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam partem domūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum in parte aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 4 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus consecratus,</quote> <trans><tr>a consecrated, holy place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 17 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. profanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:10:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum caput sanguine hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gracchi bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem Carthaginem nudatam tectis ac moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10445.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10445.6" n="1" level="3"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to elevate to the rank of deity, to place among the gods, to deify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liberum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:24:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 24, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 15, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 35</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:27 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 27 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympiadem matrem immortalitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:30" default="NO">10, 5, 30</bibl>.—And of animals:<cb n="CONS" />  videat ... cujusque generis beluas numero consecratas deorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:9:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 9, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10445.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To devote</hi> or <hi rend="ital">doom to destruction, to execrate</hi>, in laws, vows, and oaths, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 14, 33</bibl> (v. consecratio, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">caput alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:64:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 64, 3</bibl>.—And an old formula in declaring war: <cit><quote lang="la">Dis pater, Vejovis, manes ... exercitum hostium, urbes agrosque, capita aetatesque eorum devotas consecratasque habeatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 9, 10</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10445.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To surrender to the vengeance</hi> of any one: <cit><quote lang="la">esse (se) jam consecratum Miloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10445.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10445.10" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to devote, dedicate, consecrate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10445.11" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui certis quibusdam sententiis quasi addicti et consecrati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(corporis curandi) ars deorum immortalium inventioni consecrata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10445.12" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui patriae nos totos dedere et in quā nostra omnia ponere et quasi consecrare debemus,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay upon the altar of one's country</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consecrare opinionem in illo sanctissimo Hercule,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:68:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 68, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculem modo et Patrem Liberum Consecratae immortalitatis exempla referebas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>adduced as instances of deification</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10445.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hallow, recognize as holy</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sit Deus nobis non in templis sed in corde consecratus, Lact. de Ira Dei, 23, 28: secum habeat Deum semper in corde consecratum, quoniam ipse est Dei templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:25:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 25, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deum in nostro pectore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 32, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10445.14" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To make immortal, immortalize</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio disputandi (sc. Socratis) Platonis memoriā et litteris consecrata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimis monumentis consecrare memoriam nominis tui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 1, 15, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator cum jam secretus et consecratus, liber invidiā, famam in tuto collocarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium elegantissimo carmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>, ext. 3. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">consē^crātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-sā^cr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., consecrated, holy;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: CONSACRATISSIMVS, Inscr. ap. Bellerm. Vig. Rom. Laterc. p. 72, n. 283.</sense></entryFree>
consectaneus: <entryFree id="n10446" type="main" key="consecta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consectānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consector</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n10446.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Following eagerly after, hanging upon; subst., an adherent, follower</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 9</bibl>; Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 15, 3, 6.—</sense><sense id="n10446.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Consequent</hi>, = consequens: <cit><quote lang="la">consectaneum est credere,</quote> <trans><tr>it follows</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 214</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consectarius: <entryFree id="n10447" type="main" key="consecta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consectārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that follows logically, consequent</hi> (peculiar to the philos. lang. of Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">illud vero minime consectarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:18:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 18, 50</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consectārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">conclusions, inferences</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 18, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consectatio: <entryFree id="n10448" type="main" key="consecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consectātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eager pursuit of a thing, a striving after</hi> (very rare; perh. only in the foll. exs.): concinnitatis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:165" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 49, 165</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supervacua generum (uvarum) in numerum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an enumeration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consectator: <entryFree id="n10449" type="main" key="consecta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consectātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eager follower</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 2, 8 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
consectatrix: <entryFree id="n10450" type="hapax" key="consecta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consectātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consectator</etym>, <sense id="n10450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who eagerly pursues, an adherent, friend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatis libidines (opp. temperantia libidinum inimica),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 117</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consectio: <entryFree id="n10451" type="main" key="consecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conseco</etym>, <sense id="n10451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cleaving to pieces</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi consectionis ejus (materiae) fabricam haberemus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the art of fashioning it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 51, 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consecto: <entryFree id="n10452" type="main" key="consecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. consector <sense id="n10452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consector: <entryFree id="n10453" type="main" key="consector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sector</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to follow, pursue, strive after eagerly</hi>, both in a good and bad sense. </sense><sense id="n10453.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to attend eagerly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">continually; to go after a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10453.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">hos consector, his ultro arrideo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mares, feminas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">senectam ovium (opp. agnas fastidire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 47, 72, § 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angiporta haec,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 137</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rivulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 117</bibl></cit>.— More freq. (esp. in Cic.), </sense><sense id="n10453.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pursue eagerly, to strive after, endeavor to gain; to emulate an example, to imitate</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non debita consectari soleant, quod debeatur remissuros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quisquam est, qui dolorem ipsum, quia dolor sit, amet, consectetur, adipisci velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes umbras etiam falsae gloriae (corresp. with aucupari inanem rumorem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:24:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 24, 57</bibl></cit>: opes aut potentiam,<pb n="428" /> <cb n="CONS" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentiam Macedonum largitione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 19, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubertatem orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura (in discourse, opp. comprehendere brevi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:75" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista subtilius (in investigating),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 52, 53, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignia ac paene vitiosa imitando,</quote> <trans><tr>to imitate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium de industriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus Homeri (Maro),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10453.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To follow in a hostile manner, to persecule, chase, pursue</hi> (most freq. in the histt.): <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam (latrones) consectatus est et confecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:37:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 37, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redeuntes equites quos possunt consectantur atque occidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:19:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 68</bibl>.— Of the chase, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:965" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 965</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fuflum clamoribus et convitiis et sibilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victos implacabili odio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10453.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of things omnia me mala consectantur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 7</bibl>.!*? In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: uxorem tuam a populo lapidibus consectari video (<foreign lang="greek">diw/kesqai</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">to be persecuted</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
consectus: <entryFree id="n10454" type="main" key="consectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. conseco.</entryFree>
consecutio: <entryFree id="n10455" type="main" key="conse^cu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĕcūtĭo</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">consĕquūtĭo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consequor</etym> (several times in Cic. as a philos. and rhet. t. t., elsewhere perh. only in late Lat.) <sense id="n10455.0" n="I" level="1"> In philos. lang., <hi rend="ital">an effect, consequence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa detractio molestiae consecutionem adfert voluptatis,</quote> <trans><tr>has pleasure as a consequence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:29:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 29, 113</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simplex autem conclusio ex necessariā consecutione conficitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv 1, 29, 45</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:13:53 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 13, 53 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas rerum et consecutiones videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 45</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10455.1" n="II" level="1"> In rhet. lang., <hi rend="ital">the proper following of one thing after another, order, connection, sequence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum ... ne generibus, numeris, temporibus, personis, casibus perturbetur oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10455.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An acquiring, obtaining, attainment</hi> ( = adeptio; eccl. Lat.); with <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">baptismi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resurrectionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res. Carn. 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consedo: <entryFree id="n10456" type="hapax" key="conse_do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sēdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to still, allay, quiet</hi>. maximos tumultus, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 184</bibl> P</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10457" type="hapax" key="conse^do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĕdo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sedeo</etym>, <sense id="n10457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who sits with one</hi>: nemo vicinus, Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 62, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conseminalis: <entryFree id="n10458" type="hapax" key="conse_mi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sēmĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n10458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., sown with several kinds of seed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:45:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 45, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. consemineus.</sense></entryFree>
consemineus: <entryFree id="n10459" type="main" key="conse_mi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consēmĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>semen</etym>, <sense id="n10459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sown</hi> or <hi rend="ital">planted with various kinds</hi> (only in Col.). vineae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 83</bibl></cit>, cf. conseminalis.</sense></entryFree>
consenesco: <entryFree id="n10460" type="main" key="conse^nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sĕnesco</orth>, <itype>nŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch., to grow old together, to grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become old</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gray</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10460.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Baucis et Philemon) illā consenuere casā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 634</bibl></cit>: socerorum in armis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in patriā meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:12" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alieno in agro (exercitus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 34, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ultimo terrarum orbis angulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:102:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 102, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa Casilinum Cumasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Smyrnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10460.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10460.3" n="A" level="2"> In Quint., <hi rend="ital">to grow old</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gray in an occupation, to follow it too long</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in commentariis rhetorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 67</bibl></cit> in quā umbrā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 17</bibl>;
