and: <cit><quote lang="la">in unā ejus specie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10460.4" n="B" level="2"> In a more general sense (causa pro effectu), <hi rend="ital">to become weak, infirm, powerless, to waste away, fall into disuse, decay, fade, lose force</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10460.5" n="1" level="3"> With living subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">prae maerore atque aegritudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in manibus alicujus et gremio maerore et lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 34, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(columbae) si inclusae consenescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:9:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veturno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10460.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lose consideration</hi> or <hi rend="ital">respect</hi>: omnes illius partis auctores ac socios nullo adversario consenescere. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 23, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10460.7" n="2" level="3"> With inanimate subjects: ova consenescunt, Varr R. R. 3, 9, 8; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vinea soli vitio consenuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 22, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veru in manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consenuit haec tabula carie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 91</bibl></cit>: haut ulla carina Consenuit, <hi rend="ital">not one has grown old</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">all have perished</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7</bibl> (4, 6), 36: (nobis) viget aetas, animus valet; contra illis annis atque divitiis omnia consenuerunt,<cb n="CONS" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 10</bibl> Kritz and Fabri: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis consenuerint vires atque defecerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 9, 29</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 23, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum quoque patris consenuisse in adfecto corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: noster amicus Magnus, cujus cognomen unā cum Crassi Divitis cognomine consenescit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres leges aut. ipsā suā vetustate consenuisse aut novis legibus esse sublatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 247</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of laws,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabies et impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio dimetiendis pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:112" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 112</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
